topic.title: Flush a Bucket
topic.shortdesc: The Flush button provides an additional security measure to prevent unintentional loss of data.

section.title: Administrator Authorization

note.p:
To flush a bicket, an administrator must have one of these roles:
Full administrator
Cluster administrator
Bucket administrator
To learn about administrative roles in Couchbase, see .

section.note: The bucket administrator for a single bucket can flush only that particular bucket, while the bucket administrator whose name appears with an asterisk (*) can flush any of the buckets in the cluster.

body.p: As one of the administrators with the required privileges, click on the Flush button to delete every object in a bucket. Flushing will work only if this option was configured either during the initial bucket setup or after the bucket settings have been changed.
You can also use the commands the CLI command bucket-flush and REST API rest-bucket-flush.
